page.title: 07DAIRY FARMING - GILLING WEST
page.content: The dairy farmer has cows, young heifers and bullocks .Their breed is {Friesian.}The cows are kept for their milk. The land of the farm is all grass. Half the grass is cut into{silage}to feed the cows in winter, the other half is used for{grazing. } The dairy farmer gets up at 5:15 a.m. The first thing he does on the farm is {milk the cows.}After the morning milking the farmer might go{fencing, {spraying thistles and other weeds, {cleaning calf pens or putting up {walls.}After lunch the farmer gets ready for{afternoon milking.}The farmer's day usually finishes at six o'clock. The busiest time of the year for the farmer is{August to September}when heifers come into the yard and most of the{cows calve.}
